Comment: The King's Pawn opening. Allows me to make my first-choice move as black, as my queen and bishop can move to the sides of the board.
The King's Pawn game. My queen and bishop have some freedom, and control two of the diagonals.
Does this move have a name? My opponent may have wasted a move here, as his rook can only move to one square...
...as I can now move my queen's pawn into the centre, and attack his king's pawn.
He moves his kingside knight out to attack my king's pawn...
...so I capture his with my queen's pawn...
...and he captures mine with his knight.
Instead of moving my queen, I attack his knight with mine, hoping that he'd take it, so I can develop my bishop...
...but he moves it back, for some pawn cover. Moving the pawn in front of the rook has given it some protection.
So I now move my other knight out, connecting it with its twin, and attacking his...
...but developing his bishop...
...allows me to remove his knight...
...in return for mine. I'm surprsed he doubled awns on g2 and g4, instead of moving his queen, as I can now target these pawns...
...which I do with my knight, targeting the one on g4...
...but I can no longer attack it, as the bishop has now covered it...
...so I now bring my bishop into the centre of the board to allow me to castle kingside...
..and we trade pawns, but he still keeps the doubled pawns on g2 and g4...
..and we trade pawns, but he still keeps the doubled pawns on g2 and g4...
..and we trade pawns, but he still keeps the doubled pawns on g2 and g4...
...so I move my queen out to attack his king...
...he blocks with his...
...so we exchange...
...so we exchange...
